title: 114_hr4302
content: The curr_chunk is about the termination of bank functions. The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating functions transferred from the Bank, with obligations ending once all debts are settled. A report to Congress is required upon completion. Upon completion of the determination described in subsection (b), the Secretary will report it to the Committees mentioned in section 3(b). SEC. 8. DUTIES OF THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of transferred functions, outstanding obligations, and affairs of the Bank. The Secretary can delegate functions to wind up and dissolve transferred functions. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of transferred functions, outstanding obligations, and affairs of the Bank. Nothing in this Act may authorize positions and functions of the Bank after 60 days of abolishment. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS. Repeal of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions from other acts. Repeal of various sections from different acts related to the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945. The Financing and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1990 and other related acts are amended by striking certain subsections and paragraphs. The Financing and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1990 and other related acts are amended by striking certain subsections and paragraphs, including the elimination of related compensation provisions and the Office of Inspector General for the Export-Import Bank of Washington. The Office of Inspector General for the Export-Import Bank of Washington is eliminated, with amendments to the Inspector General Act of 1978. The changes will take effect on the abolishment date, and a report on necessary amendments to Federal statutes will be submitted to Congress. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive orders, rules, regulations, or documents pertaining to a department or office whose function is transferred by this Act will now refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. The term "function" includes duties, powers, activities, and programs. The term "office" includes various organizational entities.
